data: 1 00:00:18,309 --> 00:00:20,978 MAN: First there was darkness. 2 00:00:22,021 --> 00:00:24,732 Then came the strangers. 3 00:00:24,815 --> 00:00:28,235 They were a race as old as time itself. 4 00:00:28,319 --> 00:00:31,030 They had mastered the ultimate technology... 5 00:00:31,113 --> 00:00:34,032 the ability to alter physical reality... 6 00:00:34,116 --> 00:00:36,368 by will alone. 7 00:00:36,452 --> 00:00:39,455 They called this ability "tuning." 8 00:00:40,498 --> 00:00:42,374 But they were dying. 9 00:00:42,458 --> 00:00:45,002 Their civilization was in decline... 10 00:00:45,086 --> 00:00:48,089 and so they abandoned their world... 11 00:00:48,172 --> 00:00:51,800 seeking a cure for their own mortality. 12 00:00:51,884 --> 00:00:55,637 Their endless journey brought them to a small blue world... 13 00:00:55,721 --> 00:00:58,807 in the farthest corner of the galaxy... 14 00:00:58,891 --> 00:01:01,351 our world. 15 00:01:01,435 --> 00:01:03,770 Here they thought they had finally found... 16 00:01:03,854 --> 00:01:05,814 what they had been searching for. 17 00:01:16,117 --> 00:01:19,787 My name is Dr. Daniel Poe Schreber. 18 00:01:19,870 --> 00:01:21,621 I am just a man. 19 00:01:21,706 --> 00:01:24,875 I help the strangers conduct their experiments. 20 00:01:25,876 --> 00:01:29,796 I have betrayed my own kind. 21 00:01:29,880 --> 00:01:31,381 [Ticking] 22 00:01:37,722 --> 00:01:39,724 [Train horn blows] 23 00:03:12,149 --> 00:03:14,151 [Water dripping] 24 00:03:26,872 --> 00:03:27,998 Uhh! 25 00:04:02,825 --> 00:04:03,909 [Groans] 26 00:04:50,790 --> 00:04:53,083 [Phone rings] 27 00:04:55,461 --> 00:04:58,338 You are confused, aren't you? Frightened. 28 00:04:58,422 --> 00:05:00,340 That's all right. I can help you. 29 00:05:00,424 --> 00:05:01,341 Who is this? 30 00:05:01,425 --> 00:05:03,427 I am a doctor. Now, you must listen to me. 31 00:05:03,511 --> 00:05:06,138 You have lost your memory. There was an experiment. 32 00:05:06,222 --> 00:05:08,057 Something went wrong. Your memory was erased. 33 00:05:08,140 --> 00:05:09,391 Do you understand me? 34 00:05:09,475 --> 00:05:11,411 No, I don't understand. What the hell is going on here? 35 00:05:11,435 --> 00:05:14,020 Just listen. There are people coming for you even as we speak. 36 00:05:14,104 --> 00:05:17,524 You must not let them find you. You must leave now. 37 00:05:17,608 --> 00:05:20,402 Hello? Are you there? 38 00:05:27,535 --> 00:05:29,495 [Panting] 39 00:05:36,627 --> 00:05:37,628 [Elevator bell] 40 00:05:59,608 --> 00:06:01,526 [Clock strikes] 41 00:06:01,610 --> 00:06:04,404 Hey, Mr. Murdoch. The Automat called. 42 00:06:04,488 --> 00:06:07,032 Said you left your wallet there. 43 00:06:07,116 --> 00:06:10,410 I suggest you retrieve it since you only paid for 3 weeks... 44 00:06:10,494 --> 00:06:12,579 and they was up 10 minutes ago. 45 00:06:14,164 --> 00:06:16,124 I've been here 3 weeks? 46 00:06:16,208 --> 00:06:18,960 It's right there in black and white, Mr. Murdoch. 47 00:06:19,044 --> 00:06:21,129 Day and date. 48 00:06:21,213 --> 00:06:24,424 We make our books like we make our beds, all neat and tidy. 49 00:06:24,508 --> 00:06:26,843 I'll take care of it when I get back. 50 00:06:26,927 --> 00:06:29,387 See that you do. Only thing makes you a guest... 51 00:06:29,471 --> 00:06:31,764 In this joint, pal, is cash on the barrelhead. 52 00:06:31,849 --> 00:06:33,976 [Telephone ringing] 53 00:06:43,694 --> 00:06:45,779 [Splash] 54 00:06:49,658 --> 00:06:52,369 House rules. 3 weeks is 3 weeks. 55 00:06:52,453 --> 00:06:55,998 No days off for good behavior. 56 00:06:56,081 --> 00:06:57,207 Uhh! 57 00:06:58,250 --> 00:06:59,751 [Gasping] 58 00:07:02,379 --> 00:07:05,298 [Clicking tongue] 59 00:07:05,382 --> 00:07:09,511 Mr. Murdoch, yes, where is he? 60 00:07:09,595 --> 00:07:13,098 He... he just left not 5 minutes ago. 61 00:07:14,433 --> 00:07:16,351 Sleep now. 62 00:07:18,604 --> 00:07:18,687 ♪ When marimba rhythms start to play ♪ 63 00:07:18,688 --> 00:07:22,899 ♪ When marimba rhythms start to play ♪ 64 00:07:22,983 --> 00:07:24,776 ♪ Dance with me ♪ 65 00:07:24,860 --> 00:07:27,654 a“ Make me sway a“ 66 00:07:27,738 --> 00:07:31,825 ♪ Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore ♪ 67 00:07:31,909 --> 00:07:34,119 ♪ Hold me close ♪ 68 00:07:34,203 --> 00:07:37,206 a“ Sway me more a“ 69 00:07:37,289 --> 00:07:41,501 ♪ Like a flower bending in the breeze ♪ 70 00:07:41,585 --> 00:07:43,962 ♪ Bend with me ♪ 71 00:07:44,046 --> 00:07:46,673 ♪ Sway with ease ♪ 72 00:07:46,757 --> 00:07:50,677 ♪ When we dance you have a way with me ♪ 73 00:07:50,761 --> 00:07:53,180 ♪ Stay with me ♪ 74 00:07:53,263 --> 00:07:56,057 ♪ Sway with me ♪ 75 00:07:56,809 --> 00:07:58,185 Hey, sweetie! 76 00:07:58,268 --> 00:08:00,645 He said he was your husband's doctor. 77 00:08:00,729 --> 00:08:03,022 He wanted to speak with you. 78 00:08:08,070 --> 00:08:09,112 [Footsteps] 79 00:08:09,196 --> 00:08:11,448 [Door creaks] 80 00:08:15,119 --> 00:08:16,870 [Door closes] 81 00:08:21,959 --> 00:08:23,251 Excuse me. 82 00:08:25,587 --> 00:08:26,671 Dr. Sh... 83 00:08:26,755 --> 00:08:29,758 Schreber. Please, won't you come in? 84 00:08:29,842 --> 00:08:31,885 You must be Emma Murdoch. 85 00:08:31,969 --> 00:08:35,639 Thank you for coming to see me on such short notice. 86 00:08:35,723 --> 00:08:37,683 What is this? 87 00:08:37,766 --> 00:08:39,392 A rather crude experiment... 88 00:08:39,476 --> 00:08:41,311 designed to further my studies. 89 00:08:41,395 --> 00:08:44,689 I don't understand. You say you're my husband's doctor... 90 00:08:44,773 --> 00:08:47,650 but he never mentioned you to me. 91 00:08:47,735 --> 00:08:49,027 The truth is, Mrs. Murdoch... 92 00:08:49,111 --> 00:08:51,530 John has been coming to see me for quite some time. 93 00:08:51,613 --> 00:08:55,283 He had been grappling with feelings of betrayal... 94 00:08:55,367 --> 00:08:58,453 stemming from your marital difficulties. 95 00:08:58,537 --> 00:09:01,706 John told you what happened? Yes. 96 00:09:01,790 --> 00:09:04,042 When was the last time that you saw him? 97 00:09:04,126 --> 00:09:05,544 3 weeks ago. 98 00:09:05,627 --> 00:09:09,339 He packed a suitcase. He was very angry at me. 99 00:09:09,423 --> 00:09:12,384 I understand how difficult this must be for you. 100 00:09:12,468 --> 00:09:14,887 But for John's sake, I would like you... 101 00:09:14,970 --> 00:09:16,429 to think of me as your friend, Emma. 102 00:09:16,513 --> 00:09:20,225 It appears that John has suffered a psychotic break. 103 00:09:20,309 --> 00:09:22,102 Complete memory loss. 104 00:09:22,186 --> 00:09:23,604 You can't be serious. 105 00:09:23,687 --> 00:09:26,648 Oh, but I am. He may be delusional. 106 00:09:26,732 --> 00:09:29,276 Even violent. 107 00:09:29,359 --> 00:09:32,653 If he were to contact you, you must call me immediately. 108 00:09:32,738 --> 00:09:35,782 Wherever your husband is, he is searching... 109 00:09:35,866 --> 00:09:37,325 [Exhales] 110 00:09:37,409 --> 00:09:38,868 ...for himself. 111 00:09:38,952 --> 00:09:41,913 [Mouse squeaking] 112 00:09:48,754 --> 00:09:50,922 Good evening, Mr. Murdoch. 113 00:09:51,006 --> 00:09:53,717 It is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it? 114 00:09:53,801 --> 00:09:57,679 Mr... Was it "♪... something... Murdoch?" 115 00:10:00,599 --> 00:10:01,766 J. Murdoch. 116 00:10:01,850 --> 00:10:05,311 What's your name? Justin? Jerry? 117 00:10:05,395 --> 00:10:06,938 No. 118 00:10:09,066 --> 00:10:11,109 My name's Jason Murdoch. John Murdoch. 119 00:10:11,193 --> 00:10:12,569 Jake Murdoch. How's it going? 120 00:10:12,653 --> 00:10:13,779 Hi. Jack Murdoch. 121 00:10:13,862 --> 00:10:16,322 SWEEPER: Ha ha ha ha! 122 00:10:17,282 --> 00:10:18,741 Hi. 123 00:10:19,952 --> 00:10:21,995 Gotta get a grip on myself. 124 00:10:24,748 --> 00:10:27,751 [Playing accordion] 125 00:10:28,418 --> 00:10:30,920 [Clock ticking] 126 00:10:38,095 --> 00:10:39,596 [Telephone rings] 127 00:10:40,139 --> 00:10:42,724 [Stops playing] 128 00:10:42,808 --> 00:10:45,936 [Ring] 129 00:10:46,019 --> 00:10:49,147 I told the guy cash on the barrelhead. 130 00:10:49,231 --> 00:10:52,651 I said, "Listen, 3 weeks is 3 weeks." 131 00:10:52,734 --> 00:10:56,779 Where's our lucky winner? Upstairs, sir, room, uh, 614. 132 00:10:56,864 --> 00:10:59,575 Another call girl. 133 00:10:59,658 --> 00:11:02,202 "J. Murdoch." 134 00:11:03,370 --> 00:11:06,414 Evening, Husselbeck. Inspector Bumstead. 135 00:11:06,498 --> 00:11:09,000 Your lace is untied. 136 00:11:09,084 --> 00:11:10,752 [Elevator bell] Sir. 137 00:11:15,632 --> 00:11:18,343 MAN: ...exactly the same pattern. All right. 138 00:11:18,427 --> 00:11:20,679 Am I glad you're here, sir. 139 00:11:20,762 --> 00:11:23,347 They say Detective Walenski's got the heebie-jeebies. 140 00:11:23,432 --> 00:11:25,684 Just take what they give me, Husselbeck. 141 00:11:28,145 --> 00:11:29,896 MAN: OK, thanks. 142 00:11:47,706 --> 00:11:48,832 [Bell on door rings] 143 00:11:48,916 --> 00:11:50,959 MAN: Come on. I ain't got any Italian sausages. 144 00:11:51,043 --> 00:11:52,127 I'm running out of plates. 145 00:11:56,048 --> 00:11:57,841 MAN: Thanks a lot. 146 00:11:57,925 --> 00:11:59,301 Excuse me. 147 00:12:01,428 --> 00:12:03,930 Hello. Oh, it's you. 148 00:12:04,014 --> 00:12:05,682 You left your wallet here, buddy. 149 00:12:05,766 --> 00:12:07,911 Oh, when... when did I do that? When you was last here. 150 00:12:07,935 --> 00:12:11,021 When... When was that? When you left your wallet. 151 00:12:11,104 --> 00:12:12,855 You expect me to remember? 152 00:12:15,692 --> 00:12:18,528 Hello. Excuse me. 153 00:12:19,363 --> 00:12:21,782 [Men laughing] No, no, seriously. 154 00:12:21,865 --> 00:12:23,533 Heh heh heh. 155 00:12:24,618 --> 00:12:26,077 Alleged? 156 00:12:26,161 --> 00:12:28,121 [Panting] 157 00:12:38,298 --> 00:12:40,133 Where you headed, chief? Home. 158 00:12:40,217 --> 00:12:41,509 And where's home? 159 00:12:41,593 --> 00:12:44,304 Haven't you mugs got anything better to do, hm? 160 00:12:44,388 --> 00:12:46,598 Well, I'm just trying to do my job, May. 161 00:12:46,682 --> 00:12:48,785 There's a killer out there, in case you hadn't noticed. 162 00:12:48,809 --> 00:12:50,036 Maybe you should be out looking for him... 163 00:12:50,060 --> 00:12:51,436 instead of cooling your heels, huh? 164 00:12:51,520 --> 00:12:53,730 [Laughter] 165 00:12:53,814 --> 00:12:56,525 Aw, go on, get out of here. 166 00:13:04,866 --> 00:13:05,866 Come on. 167 00:13:05,909 --> 00:13:06,910 [Camera clicks] 168 00:13:09,538 --> 00:13:11,164 What's that make so far, Husselbeck? 169 00:13:11,248 --> 00:13:13,541 6 hookers in all? I believe so, sir. 170 00:13:13,625 --> 00:13:15,501 Give the man an "A" for effort. 171 00:13:20,882 --> 00:13:23,092 So, Husselbeck... 172 00:13:23,176 --> 00:13:26,512 what kind of killer do you think stops... 173 00:13:26,596 --> 00:13:29,640 to save a dying fish? 174 00:13:29,725 --> 00:13:30,725 You've got me, sir. 175 00:13:30,767 --> 00:13:32,852 CHIEF INSPECTOR: Bumstead, what took you? 176 00:13:32,936 --> 00:13:36,064 This killer's been running circles around us, thanks to Walenski. 177 00:13:36,148 --> 00:13:39,234 With all due respect, chief inspector, I've known Eddie a long time. 178 00:13:39,318 --> 00:13:40,986 He's a good cop. 179 00:13:41,069 --> 00:13:43,256 CHIEF INSPECTOR: Whatever kind of cop Walenski once was... 180 00:13:43,280 --> 00:13:45,240 he let drift a long time ago. 181 00:13:45,324 --> 00:13:47,034 WALENSKI: Let me talk to Bumstead! 182 00:13:47,117 --> 00:13:49,911 POLICEMAN: Come on! SECOND POLICEMAN: Hold on! 183 00:13:49,995 --> 00:13:52,247 Frank, Frank! 184 00:13:52,331 --> 00:13:53,665 Whoa! 185 00:13:53,749 --> 00:13:56,042 Get his arm! WALENSKI: They're watching us! 186 00:13:56,126 --> 00:13:58,503 On your feet. There's no way out! 187 00:13:59,880 --> 00:14:01,590 God, can't you see? 188 00:14:04,968 --> 00:14:06,260 Let me go, let me go! 189 00:14:06,345 --> 00:14:07,804 I'm not gonna hurt you. I'm not... 190 00:14:08,847 --> 00:14:11,099 What was that? Walenski. 191 00:14:14,478 --> 00:14:17,647 [Creaks] 192 00:14:19,483 --> 00:14:22,569 I'm being punished for my sins, right? 193 00:14:22,652 --> 00:14:24,904 What did I ever do to inherit this? 194 00:14:24,988 --> 00:14:26,030 Where do you begin? 195 00:14:26,990 --> 00:14:31,160 Well, everything Detective Walenski... committed to paper should be here, so... 196 00:14:31,244 --> 00:14:34,747 The only thing that should be committed is Walenski. 197 00:14:36,375 --> 00:14:38,710 Nothing like a little healthy paranoia. 198 00:14:41,797 --> 00:14:43,924 EMMA: Inspector Bumstead. 199 00:14:44,800 --> 00:14:47,511 I came here to file a missing persons report for my husband. 200 00:14:47,594 --> 00:14:50,179 Take it to the front desk. 201 00:14:50,263 --> 00:14:52,098 They told me to come see you. 202 00:14:53,850 --> 00:14:56,143 His name's John Murdoch. 203 00:14:58,271 --> 00:15:01,983 BUMSTEAD: Do these names mean anything to you? 204 00:15:02,067 --> 00:15:04,903 No. Who are these women? 205 00:15:04,986 --> 00:15:06,570 Why are you looking for my husband? 206 00:15:06,655 --> 00:15:09,115 Are you going to accuse him of something? 207 00:15:09,199 --> 00:15:11,451 Maybe. Maybe murder. 208 00:15:11,535 --> 00:15:12,536 Whose murder? 209 00:15:13,954 --> 00:15:14,996 Which one? 210 00:15:15,080 --> 00:15:18,541 [Laughs] All of them. 211 00:15:18,625 --> 00:15:20,793 Mrs. Murdoch, I am sorry, I'm sorry. 212 00:15:20,877 --> 00:15:23,087 I didn't mean to alarm you. I'm so sorry that I came. 213 00:15:23,171 --> 00:15:24,505 Just both made a mistake. 214 00:15:24,589 --> 00:15:28,509 Mrs. Murdoch, if you... Please, if you'll just give me half a second to explain... 215 00:15:37,853 --> 00:15:40,105 Have we met before? 216 00:15:40,188 --> 00:15:42,106 If we did... 217 00:15:42,190 --> 00:15:43,774 I hope you're still breathing. 218 00:15:43,859 --> 00:15:45,485 What's your name, honey? 219 00:15:47,154 --> 00:15:48,488 John. 220 00:15:48,572 --> 00:15:51,032 [Laughs] Well, that's an appropriate name. 221 00:15:51,908 --> 00:15:52,909 Yeah. 222 00:15:59,082 --> 00:16:00,249 I was just thinking. 223 00:16:04,463 --> 00:16:06,047 What you do... 224 00:16:07,257 --> 00:16:10,510 seems kind of dangerous... 225 00:16:10,594 --> 00:16:12,554 right now. 226 00:16:12,637 --> 00:16:14,347 I mean, how do you know I'm not the killer? 227 00:16:14,431 --> 00:16:17,600 You don't seem like the killer type. Why? 228 00:16:18,810 --> 00:16:20,450 You feeling any urges I should know about? 229 00:16:21,396 --> 00:16:22,397 Hm. 230 00:16:29,779 --> 00:16:31,489 [Door closes] 231 00:16:32,741 --> 00:16:34,617 Aw, shoot. 232 00:16:55,388 --> 00:16:56,680 Oh! 233 00:16:59,226 --> 00:17:02,229 [Sign creaks] 234 00:17:03,313 --> 00:17:05,481 [Clattering] 235 00:17:21,748 --> 00:17:25,460 So it seems you've discovered your unpleasant nature. 236 00:17:25,544 --> 00:17:26,545 Who are you? 237 00:17:26,628 --> 00:17:30,256 We might ask the same question, yes? 238 00:17:30,340 --> 00:17:32,925 Sleep now. 239 00:17:34,177 --> 00:17:36,262 [Wood creaking] 240 00:17:54,114 --> 00:17:56,616 Aah! 241 00:17:58,201 --> 00:17:59,285 He can tune. 242 00:17:59,369 --> 00:18:00,703 [Clicking] 243 00:18:19,055 --> 00:18:20,765 Uh! 244 00:18:21,349 --> 00:18:22,975 [Clicking] 245 00:18:33,236 --> 00:18:34,737 [Shrieking] 246 00:18:52,505 --> 00:18:55,633 What is to be done? This man is dangerous. 247 00:18:55,717 --> 00:18:59,053 It is said he is able to tune. Impossible. 248 00:18:59,137 --> 00:19:01,889 We have seen it with our own eyes. 249 00:19:01,973 --> 00:19:04,350 On occasion the imprinting does not take. 250 00:19:04,434 --> 00:19:07,520 They behave erratically when they awaken. 251 00:19:07,604 --> 00:19:11,024 We find them wandering like lost children. 252 00:19:11,107 --> 00:19:13,234 But this one was different, yes? 253 00:19:13,318 --> 00:19:14,986 What has the doctor to say about this? 254 00:19:15,070 --> 00:19:16,988 He has failed to report in. 255 00:19:17,072 --> 00:19:20,158 And Mr. Quick? No more Mr. Quick. 256 00:19:20,241 --> 00:19:23,327 Mr. Quick, dead, yes. 257 00:19:24,329 --> 00:19:26,539 [Clicking] 258 00:19:26,623 --> 00:19:28,833 Poor, poor Mr. Quick. 259 00:19:28,917 --> 00:19:31,878 Mr. Book, does he know? 260 00:19:33,129 --> 00:19:34,922 MR. BOOK: Should we not know, Mr. Hand? 261 00:19:35,006 --> 00:19:38,801 We had hoped to learn more before sharing with you. 262 00:19:38,885 --> 00:19:41,762 We can know nothing until we possess him. 263 00:19:41,846 --> 00:19:44,807 We must have this man. 264 00:19:50,105 --> 00:19:51,231 My brand, I hope. [Gasps] 265 00:19:52,399 --> 00:19:53,441 EMMA: John. 266 00:20:02,867 --> 00:20:05,744 I've been so worried about you. 267 00:20:09,124 --> 00:20:11,167 Are you punishing me? 268 00:20:11,251 --> 00:20:13,795 You know, if disappearing is your way of punishing me... 269 00:20:13,878 --> 00:20:14,920 I don't appreciate it. 270 00:20:15,004 --> 00:20:17,089 I don't know what you're talking about. 271 00:20:19,926 --> 00:20:22,386 I found these keys in my pocket... 272 00:20:22,470 --> 00:20:25,097 so I assume I live here. 273 00:20:25,181 --> 00:20:26,932 You supposed to be my wife? 274 00:20:27,016 --> 00:20:28,976 Supposed to be? 275 00:20:29,060 --> 00:20:31,145 John. 276 00:20:31,604 --> 00:20:33,314 You really... 277 00:20:33,398 --> 00:20:35,775 don't know who I am, do you? 278 00:20:36,693 --> 00:20:39,362 Your doctor called me. He was worried that this might happen. 279 00:20:39,446 --> 00:20:40,905 My doctor? 280 00:20:40,989 --> 00:20:43,491 Yeah. He, uh... 281 00:20:43,575 --> 00:20:45,535 he gave me his card. 282 00:20:45,618 --> 00:20:48,162 He's desperate to find you. 283 00:20:49,247 --> 00:20:51,999 Schreber. [Sighs] 284 00:20:55,044 --> 00:20:57,087 I feel like I'm living out someone else's nightmare. 285 00:20:57,172 --> 00:21:00,592 What happened to me? Why was I seeing a doctor? 286 00:21:00,675 --> 00:21:02,885 I had an affair. 287 00:21:03,887 --> 00:21:06,389 You were angry at me. 288 00:21:08,057 --> 00:21:09,683 WOMAN ON P.A.: Closing time. 289 00:21:09,768 --> 00:21:12,812 The pool is now closed. 290 00:21:19,110 --> 00:21:21,695 Dr. Schreber. 291 00:21:21,780 --> 00:21:23,406 How most unfortunate it is... 292 00:21:23,490 --> 00:21:27,327 that we were forced to seek you out here. 293 00:21:27,410 --> 00:21:31,910 You know how uncomfortable we find all this moisture. 294 00:21:32,665 --> 00:21:35,709 I'm sorry. I... Failed to report in, yes. 295 00:21:35,794 --> 00:21:38,379 I was frightened. I... I have a weak heart, you know. 296 00:21:38,463 --> 00:21:42,758 Your weakness is not, we think, an affair of the heart. 297 00:21:42,842 --> 00:21:44,969 We found this in his hotel room. 298 00:21:45,053 --> 00:21:48,931 Must we reproduce Mr. Murdoch's memories again? 299 00:21:49,015 --> 00:21:50,683 I tried to imprint him, but he woke up. 300 00:21:50,767 --> 00:21:53,162 He knocked the syringe right out of my hand. I tried to stop him. 301 00:21:53,186 --> 00:21:55,688 He has no memories, then? Only fragments. 302 00:21:55,772 --> 00:21:57,792 [Breathes heavily] The procedure, it was interrupted. 303 00:21:57,816 --> 00:22:01,569 I... I guess it's only a matter of rounding him up. 304 00:22:01,653 --> 00:22:03,196 You have had strays before, right? 305 00:22:03,279 --> 00:22:05,155 This is no stray, Doctor. 306 00:22:05,240 --> 00:22:06,866 This one can tune. 307 00:22:06,950 --> 00:22:09,994 But that's impossible. I thought only you had that ability. 308 00:22:10,078 --> 00:22:12,205 You will process another template... 309 00:22:12,288 --> 00:22:14,415 of the subject's memories, yes? 310 00:22:14,499 --> 00:22:17,043 Of course. I'll imprint him again. 311 00:22:17,126 --> 00:22:20,838 No. We require them for a quite different purpose. 312 00:22:20,922 --> 00:22:23,674 It's almost midnight, Dr. Schreber. 313 00:22:23,758 --> 00:22:25,509 We'll talk again after tonight's tuning... 314 00:22:25,593 --> 00:22:28,512 but no more delays, yes? 315 00:22:28,596 --> 00:22:33,096 No more inconsistencies in your behavior. 316 00:22:33,560 --> 00:22:34,811 [Breathes heavily] 317 00:22:34,894 --> 00:22:36,896 EMMA: The police are looking for you. 318 00:22:36,980 --> 00:22:39,232 I know. I saw the papers. 319 00:22:39,315 --> 00:22:41,900 "Killer Stalks City Streetwalkers." 320 00:22:45,321 --> 00:22:48,991 I was with one of those women... 321 00:22:49,075 --> 00:22:50,826 before I came here tonight. 322 00:22:50,910 --> 00:22:53,037 I don't understand. 323 00:22:53,121 --> 00:22:55,456 I... I met her outside an Automat. 324 00:22:55,540 --> 00:22:58,751 I guess I wanted to test myself. 325 00:22:58,835 --> 00:23:02,713 I wanted to know if I had it in me to do those things. 326 00:23:02,797 --> 00:23:05,758 Maybe I have lost my mind, but whoever I am, I'm still me... 327 00:23:05,842 --> 00:23:07,260 and I'm not a killer. 328 00:23:12,932 --> 00:23:16,393 I believe you. [Sighs] 329 00:23:16,477 --> 00:23:18,687 You do? 330 00:23:20,189 --> 00:23:22,107 [Distant sirens] 331 00:23:22,191 --> 00:23:24,234 What? 402 00:28:24,785 --> 00:28:27,746 Do you think about the past much, Frank? 403 00:28:27,830 --> 00:28:30,290 As much as the next guy. 404 00:28:30,374 --> 00:28:33,502 See, I've been trying to remember things... 405 00:28:33,586 --> 00:28:35,879 clearly remember things from my past. 406 00:28:35,963 --> 00:28:38,256 But the more I try to think back... 407 00:28:38,341 --> 00:28:41,177 the more it all starts to unravel, and... 408 00:28:41,260 --> 00:28:42,636 none of it seems real. 409 00:28:42,720 --> 00:28:46,390 It's like I've just been dreaming this life... 410 00:28:46,474 --> 00:28:49,977 and when I finally wake up, I'll be somebody else. 411 00:28:50,061 --> 00:28:51,604 Somebody totally different. 412 00:28:51,687 --> 00:28:53,271 [Gasping] 413 00:28:56,359 --> 00:28:58,986 You saw something, didn't you, Eddie? 434 00:30:30,244 --> 00:30:34,539 Not the sort of conquests you would ever understand. 435 00:30:34,623 --> 00:30:36,625 Let's see. 436 00:30:38,169 --> 00:30:40,629 A touch of unhappy childhood. 437 00:30:42,798 --> 00:30:44,132 Ahh. 438 00:30:46,469 --> 00:30:49,138 A dash of teenage rebellion. 439 00:30:50,931 --> 00:30:53,683 And last, but not least... 440 00:30:53,768 --> 00:30:55,978 a tragic death in the family. 441 00:30:56,062 --> 00:30:57,063 MR. A reflex. 515 00:39:39,918 --> 00:39:42,754 But I can teach you to control your power consciously. 516 00:39:42,838 --> 00:39:45,090 Let me help you, John. I don't know where he has gone. 533 00:41:00,582 --> 00:41:04,168 Come, Dr. Schreber. We have much to do. 534 00:41:04,252 --> 00:41:06,921 Yes? Yes. 535 00:41:09,257 --> 00:41:13,757 ♪ They say that you're a run-around lover ♪ 536 00:41:16,932 --> 00:41:20,936 ♪ Though you say ♪ 537 00:41:21,019 --> 00:41:24,814 ♪ It isn't so ♪ 538 00:41:27,859 --> 00:41:32,359 ♪ But if you put me down for another ♪ 539 00:41:36,118 --> 00:41:38,078 I I'll know I 540 00:41:38,161 --> 00:41:42,661 I Believe me, I'll know I. 541 00:41:42,833 --> 00:41:45,377 Tonight's experiment shall be conducted... 542 00:41:45,460 --> 00:41:46,961 in the following locations. 543 00:41:47,045 --> 00:41:51,545 The first subject shall be imprinted here on Avenue M. 544 00:41:51,633 --> 00:41:54,052 Mr. Book. We were unable to complete it. 546 00:41:57,681 --> 00:42:01,393 During the last tuning we detected a lack of control. 547 00:42:01,476 --> 00:42:04,061 An opposing influence on the machines? 548 00:42:04,146 --> 00:42:06,106 [Clicking] Then this man Murdoch... 549 00:42:06,189 --> 00:42:08,482 is more powerful than we thought. 550 00:42:08,567 --> 00:42:10,652 He is becoming like us. 551 00:42:10,736 --> 00:42:14,239 So we must become like him. 552 00:42:14,322 --> 00:42:17,616 The good doctor has done as we asked. 553 00:42:17,701 --> 00:42:21,746 The life and times of John Murdoch, Volume 2. 554 00:42:23,457 --> 00:42:25,750 We must not do this. 555 00:42:25,834 --> 00:42:29,295 Murdoch does not possess these memories, yes? 569 00:43:38,073 --> 00:43:40,325 Oh, yes, Mr. Book. 570 00:43:40,408 --> 00:43:44,908 I have John Murdoch... in mind. 571 00:43:44,996 --> 00:43:46,580 "Johnny..." 572 00:43:46,665 --> 00:43:50,669 "I found this postcard among your mother's things." 573 00:43:50,752 --> 00:43:53,004 "Brings back memories, doesn't it?" 574 00:43:53,088 --> 00:43:54,881 "Stop by sometime." 575 00:43:54,965 --> 00:43:58,093 "We'll see if we can't hook ourselves another mermaid." 576 00:43:58,176 --> 00:44:00,136 "Love to Emma. Can you tell me the way to Avenue C? 583 00:44:30,458 --> 00:44:32,334 Try the subway. 584 00:44:36,047 --> 00:44:37,548 You got a problem, pal? 585 00:44:37,632 --> 00:44:39,425 You, uh, been working here long? 586 00:44:39,509 --> 00:44:41,636 25 years... 587 00:44:41,720 --> 00:44:43,805 no days off for good behavior. 588 00:44:57,652 --> 00:44:58,944 [Thumping on door] 589 00:45:00,655 --> 00:45:01,656 [Muffled screaming] 590 00:45:08,955 --> 00:45:12,166 We're looking for John Murdoch. 591 00:45:35,148 --> 00:45:36,440 [Train bell] 592 00:45:43,657 --> 00:45:46,034 - Shhhh. - [Crying] 593 00:45:46,117 --> 00:45:48,160 She knows nothing, Mr. Hand. 594 00:45:48,245 --> 00:45:50,330 A dead end, yes, Mr. Wall. 595 00:45:50,413 --> 00:45:52,957 We thought his imprint would allow us to track him, yes... 596 00:45:53,041 --> 00:45:55,460 but instead we have been brought here. 597 00:45:55,543 --> 00:45:59,463 - This is irrational. - Instincts are irrational, Mr. Wall... 598 00:45:59,547 --> 00:46:02,967 and we must follow where they lead, yes. 599 00:46:03,051 --> 00:46:06,137 Mr. Sleep suggests he may go to places familiar... 600 00:46:06,221 --> 00:46:07,472 his job. 601 00:46:07,555 --> 00:46:09,557 He does not care about our job. 602 00:46:09,641 --> 00:46:12,435 Indulge us, Mr. Hand. 603 00:46:12,519 --> 00:46:15,146 If you were Murdoch... I refuse. 940 01:09:29,915 --> 01:09:31,499 You... You can't make me go there! 941 01:09:31,583 --> 01:09:34,127 Don't you understand? They'll be waiting for us. 942 01:09:43,220 --> 01:09:45,055 BUMSTEAD: I don't understand. 943 01:09:45,138 --> 01:09:46,764 Used to be a bridge here. 944 01:09:47,557 --> 01:09:49,934 [Panting] 945 01:09:51,061 --> 01:09:52,437 [Grunts] 946 01:09:53,480 --> 01:09:56,399 Try that again, your friends are gonna be fishing you out of the canal. 947 01:09:56,483 --> 01:09:58,044 Just don't hurt me. I'll tell you everything. 948 01:09:58,068 --> 01:09:59,986 It doesn't matter anymore anyway. 949 01:10:06,910 --> 01:10:09,162 What? [Gasps] 950 01:10:10,789 --> 01:10:13,082 Who are you people? 951 01:10:13,166 --> 01:10:16,002 SCHREBER: We must go to the end of the canal. 952 01:10:17,254 --> 01:10:21,754 We will give you some more pretty things soon... Anna. 953 01:10:21,842 --> 01:10:23,552 I'm not Anna. 954 01:10:25,303 --> 01:10:27,305 You will be soon, yes. 955 01:10:31,309 --> 01:10:34,186 I have another use for her first. 956 01:10:43,280 --> 01:10:46,283 I call them... the strangers. 957 01:10:46,366 --> 01:10:49,452 They abducted us and brought us here. 958 01:10:49,536 --> 01:10:53,957 This city, everyone in it, is their experiment. 959 01:10:54,040 --> 01:10:57,209 They mix and match our memories as they see fit... 960 01:10:57,294 --> 01:11:00,297 trying to divine what makes us unique. 961 01:11:00,380 --> 01:11:03,091 One day, a man might be an inspector. 962 01:11:03,175 --> 01:11:06,094 The next, someone entirely different. 963 01:11:06,178 --> 01:11:09,431 When they want to study a murderer, for instance... 964 01:11:09,514 --> 01:11:14,014 they simply imprint one of their citizens with a new personality... 965 01:11:14,394 --> 01:11:18,439 arrange a family for him... friends, an entire history... 966 01:11:18,523 --> 01:11:20,316 even a lost wallet. 967 01:11:20,400 --> 01:11:22,568 Then they observe the results. 968 01:11:24,029 --> 01:11:26,448 Willa man, given the history of a killer... 969 01:11:26,531 --> 01:11:28,074 continue in that vein? 970 01:11:28,158 --> 01:11:29,826 Or are we, in fact... 971 01:11:29,910 --> 01:11:32,162 more than the mere sum of our memories? 972 01:11:32,245 --> 01:11:34,538 This business of you being a killer... 973 01:11:34,623 --> 01:11:37,167 was an unhappy coincidence. 974 01:11:37,250 --> 01:11:40,086 You have had dozens of lives before now. 975 01:11:40,170 --> 01:11:41,504 You just happened to wake up... 976 01:11:41,588 --> 01:11:44,173 while I was imprinting you... with this one. 977 01:11:44,257 --> 01:11:46,342 Why are they doing all this? 978 01:11:46,426 --> 01:11:49,762 It is our capacity for individuality... 979 01:11:49,846 --> 01:11:52,390 our souls, that makes us different from them. 980 01:11:52,474 --> 01:11:54,809 They think they can find the human soul... 981 01:11:54,893 --> 01:11:57,604 if they understand how our memories work. 982 01:11:57,687 --> 01:11:59,271 All they have are collective memories. 983 01:11:59,356 --> 01:12:02,150 They share one group mind. 984 01:12:02,234 --> 01:12:03,652 They're dying, you see? 985 01:12:03,735 --> 01:12:07,113 Their entire race is on the brink of extinction. 986 01:12:07,197 --> 01:12:08,990 They think we can save them. Ha. 987 01:12:09,074 --> 01:12:12,077 Where do I fit in? You are different, John. 988 01:12:12,160 --> 01:12:14,954 You resisted my attempt to imprint you. 989 01:12:19,626 --> 01:12:22,545 Somehow you have developed their ability to tune. 990 01:12:22,629 --> 01:12:25,840 That is how they change things. That is how they built this city. 991 01:12:25,924 --> 01:12:30,011 They have machines buried deep beneath the surface that allow them... 992 01:12:30,095 --> 01:12:33,515 to focus their telepathic energies. 993 01:12:33,598 --> 01:12:36,058 They control everything here, even the sun. 994 01:12:36,142 --> 01:12:39,603 That's why it's always dark. They can't stand the light. 995 01:12:39,688 --> 01:12:40,814 So why do they need you? 996 01:12:40,897 --> 01:12:43,065 When they first brought us here... 997 01:12:43,149 --> 01:12:44,817 they extracted what was in us. 998 01:12:44,901 --> 01:12:46,903 So they could store the information... 999 01:12:46,987 --> 01:12:49,072 remix it like so much paint... 1000 01:12:49,155 --> 01:12:51,699 and give us back new memories of their choosing. 1001 01:12:51,783 --> 01:12:55,411 But they still needed an artist to help them. 1002 01:12:57,205 --> 01:13:00,333 I understood the intricacies of the human mind... 1003 01:13:00,417 --> 01:13:02,919 better than they ever could... 1004 01:13:03,003 --> 01:13:05,714 so they allowed me... to keep my skills as a scientist... 1005 01:13:05,797 --> 01:13:07,131 because they needed them. 1006 01:13:07,215 --> 01:13:09,675 But they made me delete everything else. 1007 01:13:14,180 --> 01:13:16,098 [Sobbing] 1008 01:13:18,018 --> 01:13:20,895 Can you imagine what it is like being forced... 1009 01:13:20,979 --> 01:13:22,605 to erase your own past? 1010 01:13:22,689 --> 01:13:24,607 What about my past? 1011 01:13:24,691 --> 01:13:26,901 What about my childhood? 1012 01:13:26,985 --> 01:13:29,612 Shell Beach, Uncle Karl. 1013 01:13:29,696 --> 01:13:32,573 What about this? 1014 01:13:32,657 --> 01:13:34,450 This was blank when I found it! 1015 01:13:34,534 --> 01:13:36,452 You still don't understand, John. 1016 01:13:36,536 --> 01:13:39,705 You were never a boy, not in this place. 1017 01:13:39,789 --> 01:13:42,666 Your entire history is an illusion, a fabrication... 1018 01:13:42,751 --> 01:13:44,461 as it is with all of us. 1019 01:13:44,544 --> 01:13:47,088 You made those drawings happen with your gift. 1020 01:13:47,172 --> 01:13:50,717 You say they brought us here. 1021 01:13:50,800 --> 01:13:51,884 From where? 1022 01:13:55,805 --> 01:13:57,807 I'm sorry. 1023 01:13:57,891 --> 01:13:59,642 I don't remember. 1024 01:13:59,726 --> 01:14:01,477 None of us remember that. 1025 01:14:01,561 --> 01:14:03,771 What we once were... 1026 01:14:03,855 --> 01:14:06,190 what we might have been... 1027 01:14:06,274 --> 01:14:07,692 somewhere else. 1028 01:14:21,164 --> 01:14:23,166 [Wind whistling] 1029 01:14:25,168 --> 01:14:27,086 I've taken you this far. 1030 01:14:27,170 --> 01:14:29,255 You don't need me anymore. 1031 01:14:29,339 --> 01:14:31,174 Let's go. 1032 01:14:38,056 --> 01:14:40,558 [Schreber breathing heavily] 1033 01:14:49,567 --> 01:14:51,110 John. 1034 01:15:15,176 --> 01:15:18,012 There is no ocean, John. 1035 01:15:18,096 --> 01:15:22,183 There is nothing beyond the city. 1036 01:15:22,267 --> 01:15:25,520 The only place home exists... 1037 01:15:27,355 --> 01:15:29,440 is in your head. 1038 01:15:37,741 --> 01:15:39,409 No! No! 1039 01:15:39,492 --> 01:15:41,327 John, stop! 1040 01:15:41,411 --> 01:15:43,371 [Both grunting] 1041 01:15:43,955 --> 01:15:45,081 No! 1042 01:15:47,792 --> 01:15:48,793 Stop! 1043 01:15:54,758 --> 01:15:56,134 Please! 1044 01:15:56,801 --> 01:15:58,219 No! 1045 01:16:00,972 --> 01:16:02,306 Aah! Uhh! 1046 01:16:02,390 --> 01:16:04,392 [Both gasping] 1047 01:16:16,488 --> 01:16:18,656 And now you know the truth. 1048 01:16:26,498 --> 01:16:27,999 STRANGER: Ahhh! 1049 01:16:32,212 --> 01:16:35,381 [Grunting] 1050 01:16:35,465 --> 01:16:36,799 Aah! 1051 01:16:36,883 --> 01:16:37,925 [Screaming] 1052 01:16:38,009 --> 01:16:40,302 - No! - [Grunts] 1053 01:16:40,386 --> 01:16:41,762 Aah! 1054 01:16:43,973 --> 01:16:45,349 [Grunts] 1055 01:17:18,007 --> 01:17:20,843 You'll allow yourself to surrender, Mr. Murdoch... 1056 01:17:20,927 --> 01:17:23,137 or it will result in this one's death, yes? 1057 01:17:23,221 --> 01:17:26,933 What do I care? She's not my real wife! She's nothing to me! 1058 01:17:27,016 --> 01:17:31,516 But you do still care, don't you, Mr. Murdoch? 1059 01:17:31,813 --> 01:17:33,898 You see, I have become the monster... 1060 01:17:33,982 --> 01:17:35,942 you were intended to be. 1061 01:17:36,025 --> 01:17:37,651 Uhh! 1062 01:17:37,735 --> 01:17:41,613 Shall I end her life now as you would have? 1063 01:17:44,659 --> 01:17:46,869 Don't hurt her, please! 1064 01:17:46,953 --> 01:17:51,453 Then surrender, Mr. Murdoch. 1065 01:17:51,624 --> 01:17:53,208 Sleep. 1066 01:17:53,293 --> 01:17:55,044 [Gasping] 1067 01:17:55,128 --> 01:17:57,296 Now. 1068 01:17:59,132 --> 01:18:00,800 John? 1069 01:18:15,815 --> 01:18:17,024 Sleep. 1070 01:18:26,159 --> 01:18:27,577 Kill him. 1071 01:18:27,660 --> 01:18:29,244 Kill him! Kill him! 1072 01:18:29,329 --> 01:18:31,998 ALL: Kill him! Kill him! Kill him! 1073 01:18:32,081 --> 01:18:34,917 Kill him! Kill him! 1074 01:18:35,001 --> 01:18:38,754 Kill him! Kill him! Kill him! 1075 01:18:38,838 --> 01:18:41,340 He is powerful, yes. 1076 01:18:41,424 --> 01:18:45,845 Dangerous. But he can also lead us to what we seek. 1077 01:18:45,929 --> 01:18:49,265 What the doctor calls the soul. 1078 01:18:49,349 --> 01:18:53,019 It is time for our experiment to move into a final phase. 1079 01:18:53,102 --> 01:18:55,771 We no longer need the other subjects. 1080 01:18:55,855 --> 01:18:59,441 The time for study is over. 1081 01:18:59,525 --> 01:19:03,779 It is time to be one with John Murdoch. 1082 01:19:10,453 --> 01:19:12,204 It is time, Doctor. 1083 01:19:12,288 --> 01:19:13,831 Imprint. 1084 01:19:16,626 --> 01:19:19,295 Shut it down! 1085 01:19:19,379 --> 01:19:22,590 Shut it down forever! 1086 01:19:36,396 --> 01:19:37,730 What are you doing? 1087 01:19:38,731 --> 01:19:40,649 They want to imprint you... 1088 01:19:40,733 --> 01:19:43,318 with their own collective memories. 1089 01:19:44,654 --> 01:19:46,489 They want to make you one of them... 1090 01:19:46,572 --> 01:19:48,782 so they can share your soul. 1091 01:19:48,866 --> 01:19:51,243 But I've got other plans. 1092 01:19:53,496 --> 01:19:54,830 [Chimes] 1093 01:19:54,914 --> 01:19:57,166 Imprint, Doctor. No more disobedience. 1094 01:19:57,250 --> 01:19:59,168 I'm sorry, John. [Whimpers] 1095 01:19:59,252 --> 01:20:02,171 The pain will only last a moment. 1096 01:20:04,257 --> 01:20:05,258 No! 1097 01:20:13,433 --> 01:20:15,685 Remember, John. 1098 01:20:15,768 --> 01:20:18,187 You'll rise to greater heights than that, my boy. 1099 01:20:18,271 --> 01:20:20,031 One day when you're older, you'll understand. 1100 01:20:21,899 --> 01:20:23,025 Remember. 1101 01:20:23,109 --> 01:20:24,110 [Whistle] 1102 01:20:24,193 --> 01:20:27,029 That's it, John. Practice makes perfect. 1103 01:20:27,113 --> 01:20:30,282 Now remember what I told you. Never talk to strangers. 1104 01:20:30,366 --> 01:20:32,076 John, remember. 1105 01:20:32,160 --> 01:20:35,037 You're probably wondering why I keep appearing in your memories. 1106 01:20:35,121 --> 01:20:37,665 It is because I have inserted myself in them. 1107 01:20:37,749 --> 01:20:39,792 All of these memories have been fabricated... 1108 01:20:39,876 --> 01:20:41,544 to teach you about the strangers. 1109 01:20:41,627 --> 01:20:44,671 Give you a lifetime of knowledge in a single syringe. 1110 01:20:47,592 --> 01:20:49,885 You will survive, John. 1111 01:20:49,969 --> 01:20:52,221 You will find strength within yourself... 1112 01:20:52,305 --> 01:20:54,181 and you will prevail. 1113 01:20:54,265 --> 01:20:56,392 Remember. 1114 01:20:56,476 --> 01:20:58,478 Hi, Uncle Karl. Johnny! 1115 01:21:01,439 --> 01:21:03,566 You're getting the hang of it, John. 1116 01:21:03,649 --> 01:21:06,234 Maybe one day I'll be working for you. 1117 01:21:06,319 --> 01:21:09,697 This is the machine the strangers use to amplify their thoughts. 1118 01:21:09,781 --> 01:21:11,574 The machine that changes their world. 1119 01:21:11,657 --> 01:21:13,200 You must take control of it. 1120 01:21:13,284 --> 01:21:14,868 You must make the machine yours. 1121 01:21:14,952 --> 01:21:17,037 I know you can beat them, John. 1122 01:21:17,121 --> 01:21:18,789 But you must concentrate. 1123 01:21:21,709 --> 01:21:22,835 Something's wrong. 1124 01:21:23,753 --> 01:21:24,879 [John gasps] 1125 01:21:27,465 --> 01:21:29,175 Aah! 1126 01:21:31,511 --> 01:21:34,180 There is no time for romance, John. 1127 01:21:34,263 --> 01:21:35,639 The world can be what you make it. 1128 01:21:36,641 --> 01:21:38,601 What have you done? 1129 01:21:38,684 --> 01:21:41,228 You have the power to make anything happen... 1130 01:21:41,312 --> 01:21:43,605 but you must act now! 1131 01:21:58,079 --> 01:21:59,538 Aahhh! 1132 01:22:15,221 --> 01:22:16,889 [Grunts] 1133 01:22:49,714 --> 01:22:51,132 Aaah! 1134 01:23:02,560 --> 01:23:05,187 - Ahhhhhh! - Ahhhhhh! 1135 01:24:01,661 --> 01:24:04,664 Aah! 1136 01:24:10,294 --> 01:24:12,170 Aah! 1137 01:24:14,924 --> 01:24:16,050 Aaah! 1138 01:24:19,262 --> 01:24:21,639 [All screaming] 1139 01:25:22,491 --> 01:25:24,117 [Grunting] 1140 01:25:30,374 --> 01:25:32,167 Raah! 1141 01:25:34,045 --> 01:25:36,255 Aah! 1142 01:26:06,118 --> 01:26:10,618 [Shrieking] 1143 01:26:27,431 --> 01:26:29,057 I knew you could do it, John. 1144 01:26:29,141 --> 01:26:31,143 You have their power now. 1145 01:26:31,227 --> 01:26:32,811 You control their machines. 1146 01:26:32,895 --> 01:26:34,479 Where's Emma? 1147 01:26:34,563 --> 01:26:37,732 She is not Emma anymore, John. 1148 01:26:37,817 --> 01:26:39,485 She has been re-imprinted. 1149 01:26:39,568 --> 01:26:40,902 So give her back her memories. 1150 01:26:40,986 --> 01:26:43,405 I can't. The facility where the strangers... 1151 01:26:43,489 --> 01:26:46,408 stored the memories has been destroyed. 1152 01:26:46,492 --> 01:26:47,659 I'm sorry. 1153 01:26:48,703 --> 01:26:51,747 What are you going to do now, John? 1154 01:26:54,208 --> 01:26:57,294 Gonna fix things. 1155 01:26:57,378 --> 01:27:01,090 You told me I had the power, didn't you? 1156 01:27:01,173 --> 01:27:05,427 I can make these machines do anything I want. 1157 01:27:05,511 --> 01:27:08,514 Make this world anything I want it to be. 1158 01:27:08,597 --> 01:27:12,934 Just so long as I concentrate hard enough. 1159 01:28:29,220 --> 01:28:30,763 [Chimes] 1160 01:28:36,519 --> 01:28:37,978 SCHREBER: Where are you going? 1161 01:28:41,232 --> 01:28:42,733 Shell Beach. 1162 01:29:01,252 --> 01:29:03,254 [Traffic noises] 1163 01:29:23,607 --> 01:29:24,899 What's the fare? Quarter. 1164 01:29:24,984 --> 01:29:28,612 [Indistinct chatter] 1165 01:29:31,198 --> 01:29:32,198 Oh, please. 1166 01:29:32,241 --> 01:29:34,743 Oh, no... It's fine. 1167 01:29:34,827 --> 01:29:36,161 Thank you. OK. 1168 01:30:16,368 --> 01:30:18,328 MAN: John... 1169 01:30:21,832 --> 01:30:24,125 been waiting for you, yes? 1170 01:30:24,209 --> 01:30:25,793 What are you doing? 1171 01:30:25,878 --> 01:30:28,714 I'm just making a few little changes around here, is all. 1172 01:30:28,797 --> 01:30:30,965 Are we sure that's what we want? 1173 01:30:31,050 --> 01:30:33,802 I'm prepared to take my chances. 1174 01:30:33,886 --> 01:30:35,470 I'm dying, John. 1175 01:30:35,554 --> 01:30:39,599 Your imprint is not agreeable with my kind. 1176 01:30:39,683 --> 01:30:43,645 But I wanted to know what it was like... 1177 01:30:43,729 --> 01:30:45,063 how you feel. 1178 01:30:45,147 --> 01:30:47,816 You know how I was supposed to feel. 1179 01:30:47,900 --> 01:30:51,653 That person isn't me. It never was. 1180 01:30:51,737 --> 01:30:56,237 You wanted to know what it was about us that made us human. 1181 01:30:56,450 --> 01:31:00,950 Well, you're not going to find it... in here. 1182 01:31:01,580 --> 01:31:04,207 You went looking in the wrong place. 1183 01:31:53,298 --> 01:31:54,841 Aah! 1184 01:32:42,931 --> 01:32:44,849 It's so beautiful here. 1185 01:32:50,189 --> 01:32:51,648 80 bright. 1186 01:32:57,529 --> 01:33:00,323 Do you know if Shell Beach is around here? 1187 01:33:00,407 --> 01:33:03,034 I think that's it just over there. 1188 01:33:21,053 --> 01:33:23,221 I'm headed that way myself. 1189 01:33:24,723 --> 01:33:27,225 Would you like to join me? 1190 01:33:29,394 --> 01:33:30,436 Sure. 1191 01:33:35,776 --> 01:33:38,320 I'm Anna, by the way. 1192 01:33:38,403 --> 01:33:40,780 What's your name? John. 1193 01:33:43,200 --> 01:33:44,618 John Murdoch. 1194 01:38:33,115 --> 01:38:37,119 ♪ When marimba rhythms start to play ♪ 1195 01:38:37,202 --> 01:38:39,412 ♪ Dance with me ♪ 1196 01:38:39,496 --> 01:38:42,290 ♪ Make me sway ♪ 1197 01:38:42,374 --> 01:38:46,461 ♪ Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore ♪ 1198 01:38:46,545 --> 01:38:48,797 ♪ Hold me close ♪ 1199 01:38:48,880 --> 01:38:51,799 ♪ Sway me more ♪ 1200 01:38:51,883 --> 01:38:55,970 I Like a flower bending in the breeze ♪ 1201 01:38:56,054 --> 01:38:58,306 ♪ Bend with me ♪ 1202 01:38:58,390 --> 01:39:01,184 ♪ Sway with ease ♪ 1203 01:39:01,268 --> 01:39:05,313 ♪ When we dance you have a way with me ♪ 1204 01:39:05,397 --> 01:39:07,690 ♪ Stay with me ♪ 1205 01:39:07,774 --> 01:39:10,276 ♪ Sway with me ♪ 1206 01:39:10,360 --> 01:39:14,860 ♪ Other dancers may be on the floor ♪ 1207 01:39:15,157 --> 01:39:19,657 ♪ But my eyes will see only you ♪ 1208 01:39:19,911 --> 01:39:24,411 ♪ Only you have that magic technique ♪ 1209 01:39:25,750 --> 01:39:29,503 ♪ When we sway I go weak ♪ 1210 01:39:29,588 --> 01:39:33,341 ♪ I can hear the sound of violins ♪ 1211 01:39:33,425 --> 01:39:37,925 ♪ Long before it begins ♪ 1212 01:39:38,847 --> 01:39:42,725 ♪ Make me thrill as only you know how ♪ 1213 01:39:42,809 --> 01:39:47,309 ♪ Sway me smooth, sway me now ♪ 1214 01:39:48,190 --> 01:39:51,318 ♪ You gotta sway me now ♪ 1215 01:39:51,401 --> 01:39:53,778 ♪ Come on, babe ♪ 1216 01:39:53,862 --> 01:39:55,738 ♪ Come on, babe ♪ 1217 01:39:55,822 --> 01:40:00,322 ♪ Sway, sway, take me ♪ 1218 01:40:06,374 --> 01:40:08,834 ♪ Sway me ♪
